strapiPost.title: Arkansas Baseball Goes Down Swinging
strapiPost.content:
After a valiant effort, the Arkansas Razorback Baseball team was eliminated from the College Worlds Series yesterday after they fell to SEC foe, Ole Miss.

  • Fight or flight: The Razorbacks finished the season 46-21 overall, which puts them in an elite class as the only program in the country with 5 consecutive 45 win seasons (omitting 2020). The Hogs were knocked out of the tournament last night as one of the final 4 teams remaining.
  • Honorable mentions: However, not all is loss as the team had their first ever Golden Glove Award winner, showed a strong effort in post season tournament play, and with a young class of talent, we have much to look forward to in the coming years.

Next up - football in only a short 71 days.
